text: Thomas Moore Raworth (July 19, 1938 â€“ February 8, 2017) known as Tom Raworth, was a British poet and visual artist. He published over forty books of poetry and prose during his life. His work has been translated and published in many countries. Raworth was a key figure in the British Poetry Revival. Raworth died at his home in London, England on February 8, 2017 from prostate cancer- related complications, aged 78. ==References== ==Other websites== *Raworth at EPC (includes extensive bibliography) *"Tom Raworth", 9th International Literature Festival Berlin *Tom Raworth's Home Page *"Add-Verse" a poetry- photo-video project Tom Raworth participated in *Raworth archive at University of Connecticut *David Ball biography at Smith College Category:1938 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Cancer deaths in London Category:British poets Category:British artists Category:Writers from London
title: Tom Raworth
